Pritilata Waddedar was born in Chattogram on 5 May 1911. She was a meritórious student at Dr. Khastagir Government Girls' School in Chattogram and Eden College, Dhaka. She graduated in Philosophy with distinction from Bethune College in Kolkata. In her college days, 'Pritilata was an activist in the anti-British movement. All through her life, she dreamt of two things: a society without gender discrimination, and her motherland free from British colonial rule.
So, she decided to fight against the British rule. Soon after, Pritilata became the head teacher of Nandankanon Aparna Charan School in Chattogram. Gradually she involved herself in Surja Sen's armed resistance movement. Surja Sen was a famous anti-British movement organizer and revolutionary activist in Chattogram area at that time. In 1932, Surja Sen planned an attack on the Pahartali European Club. The Club was well-known for its notorious sign at its entrance: Dogs and Indians not allowed. Surja Sen assigned Pritilata to lead a team of 10 − 12 10-12 10 − 12 men to attack the Club. The raid was successful but Pritilata, dressed as a man, failed to get out of the Club. She committed suicide by taking potassium cyanide to avoid arrest. She proved that women can work like men. She also proved that women too needed to be prepared to sacrifice their lives for the freedom from the British colonial rule. Her dream finally came true. The British rule came to an end in 1947 though she couldn't see it during her lifetime.

Sher-e-Bangla is one of the most popular leaders of Bangladesh. He was born in 1873 at Chakhar in Barishal. His father Mohammad Wazed Ali was a famous lawyer. He passed the Entrance Examination and went to Calcutta for higher studies. At the age of 22, he passed MA and was placed in the first division. After two years, he obtained BL degree with distinction and joined the Bar. At the age of 33 , he was appointed Deputy Magistrate. He resigned his post in 1912, due to difference of opinion with the government. In 1913, he became the member of Bengal Council. In 1915, he defeated Khaja Nazimuddin miserably in the election of Patuakhali. In 1918, he was made the General Secrefary of Indian Congress. In the same year, he was made President of All India Muslim League. He was the Chief Minister of Bengal. In 1924, he established many educational institutions in Bengal as an Education Minister. He was the Mayor of Calcutta Corporation in 1935-1936. In 1937, he was the first elected Prime Minister of Bengal. On 23rd March 1940, he proposed his historical Pakistan Resolution in Lahore Conference of Muslim League. He led the United Front in the general election of East Pakistan until 1958. He died at the age of 89 . The people of Bangladesh remember him with gratitude.
Write a summary of the above passage in your own words.

sub_questions.explanation: The passage is about Sher-e-Bangla (1873 - 1962) who was born in Barishal. He obtained M.A. degree in 1895 and B.L. degree in 1897. The difference of opinion between him and the government made him resign from his post as a Dejputy Magistrate. In 1915's election, he defeated Khaja Najimuddin. Later, he became the General Secretary of Indian Congress and the President of All India Muslim League. Moreover, he was the Chief Minister, Education Minister and also the first Prime Minister of Bengal. He proposed the historical Pakistan Resolution in 1940.

questions.uddipok:
Answer the following questions to write a paragraph on 'A Book Fair':
(a) What is a book fair? (b) When and where is it held? (c) How popular is it? (d) Have you ever visitied a book fair? (e) What kind of books are usually available in a book fair?

sub_questions.explanation:
A Book Fair
A book fair is a kind of fair where different types of books are displayed for sale. Book fair is now held in every city and town too. It has recently become very popular in our country. People go to the fair to find their desired books. In Bangladesh, a book fair is arranged on the occasion of 21 s t 21^{st} 2 1 s t February, 16 th 16^{\text {th }} 1 6 th December, 26 th 26^{\text {th }} 2 6 th March and Bangla New Year. The fair is held in an open place or in auditorium or in a big hall-room. In our country, the largest book fair is held on the premises of Bangla Academy on the occasion of 21 t h 21^{th} 2 1 t h February. All kinds of books such as fiction, drama, poetry, novel, biography, translation, children literature, story books, etc. are usually available in a book fair. A book fair usually remains crowded. People from all walks of life visit the fair. People who are book lovers come to the fair to buy books and to enjoy the fair. Young boys and girls gather here to find out books of their favourite authors. They buy books to present them as gifts to their near and dear ones and for themselves. From the interest and participation of people, the popularity of book fair in our country can be realised. A book fair bears great importance. Moreover, it creates a sense of interest for books among the general people. It is really an exceptional place. It develops and flourishes our reading habits and thus makes us enlightened. It also helps develop our creativity.

Tamim, a student of class ten, was returning from school. On the way, he saw some boys and girl bathing in the pond. Suddenly, he heard a girl shouting "Help! Help! Save me!" Tamim……………..

sub_questions.explanation:
You Win Some, You Lose Some
Tamim, a student of class ten, was returning fromschool. On the way, he saw some boys and girls bathing in the pond. Suddenly, he heard a girl shouting "Help! Help! Save me!" Tamim quickly ran towards them to assess the situation: From a distance he noticed the girl waving her hands in the air desperately. Since there was no time, he dived, into the water wearing his clothes. He even forgot to take off his backpack. Although he was never a good swimmer, sensing the danger the girl was in, he swam to the middle very quickly. He grabbed the girl's hand and helped her reach the edge of the pond. Near the edge, the boys who were swimming. earlier 'stood concerned. They helped Tamim bring the girl out of the water. Once their feet touched the land, Tamim took a breath of relief and sat down to catch his breath. With drenched clothes and ruined notebooks, he listened to the boys explaining how the girl floated away from them and almost drowned. Everyone thanked him and in reply he could only smile. He was glad that the only thing he couldn't save that day was his notebooks.

Comparative number of deaths caused by road accidents in Bangladesh in the first six months of the year 2022-2023:

sub_questions.explanation: The graph shows the comparative number of death caused by road accidents in the first six month of the years 2022 and 2023. 416 people died by road accidents in January, 2023 and 340 people died in January, 2022. There were 427 deaths in February, 2023 and 356 deaths in February, 2022. The lowest number of deaths can be noticed in March of 2023 and 2022, which are 362 and 309 respectively. On the contrary, the highest numbers of deaths in the graph are shown to have occurred in April of 2023 and 2022 when 620 and 425 people died respectively. Then in May of 2023 and 2022 there were 390 and 410 deaths respectively. Lastly, June, with a number of deaths higher than May, recorded 511 people dead in 2023 and 418 people in 2022. In conclusion, the number of deaths in 2023 was higher.

questions.uddipok: Write a dialogue between you and the librarian of your school library on borrowing book.

sub_questions.explanation:
You: Good morning, ma'am! Librarian: Good morning! How can I help you today?
You: I’d like to borrow a book, please. Librarian: Sure! Which book are you looking for?
You: I was hoping to borrow To Kill a Mockingbird by Harper Lee. Do you have it available? Librarian: Let me check the catalog for you. Please wait for a moment. (She checks the database) Yes, we do have a copy of it. Would you like a hardback or paperback version?
You: A paperback would be fine, thank you!
Librarian: Here it is. Make sure to write your name and the book’s details in the borrowing register. You know our borrowing policy, right?
You: Yes, ma'am. I need to return it within 15 days, right?
Librarian: Exactly! If you need an extension, you can renew it once before the due date. Just make sure you return it in good condition.
You: Of course, ma'am. Thank you very much!
Librarian: You’re welcome. Enjoy reading! If you need more books, feel free to ask.
You: I will. Thanks again. Have a great day!
Librarian: You too!
